result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lauro Manuel Garcia

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Ruby De Leon in court with Lauro Manuel Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew, via zoom. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties prepared to proceed. Court will be in Jury Trial on another matter. Case adjourned, branch 30.
Jury trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lauro Manuel Garcia in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lauro Manuel Garcia appeared by video means with Attorney.
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 30.
Final pre-trial on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lauro Manuel Garcia in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lauro Manuel Garcia in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference/status of counsel.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Ruby De Leon to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 09/01/2022 and on the first of every month thereafter until paid in full. Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment.
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lauro Manuel Garcia in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lauro Manuel Garcia appeared by video means.
Case in court for Pretrial conference. Defendant appears without counsel. Court hold colloquy with defendant for a court appointed attorney. Defendant requests assistance of a spanish interpreter. Court adjourns matter for an indigency hearing where a spanish interpreter will be present to assist. Case remains calendared in Br. 30. Indigency hearing is scheduled on June 1, 2022 at 1:30pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/1/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.S.R.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lauro Manuel Garcia in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/29/2022@02:00pm
